instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a green light no power
threads.message:
got a 820-00165 in has a green light but no power.  i replaced the isl but still same green light. checked ppbus getting 7.5v on a low battery so g3h is good. can it only be the isl at this point?  

Thanks
Nate

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a green light no power
threads.message: Does the charger turns orange after a few seconds???

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a green light no power
threads.message: no it stays green with battery connected

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a green light no power
threads.message: im testing on the r5450 ppbus is giving 8.2v with only the charger connected

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a green light no power
threads.message: SMC is not running. Check SMC_RESET and check corrosion around/under SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a green light no power
threads.message: i replaced the u5010 and now im getting 3.4v on smc_reset before it was not present.  checked ppbus and its still at 8.3v  i did an smc bypass by holding powre down and dropping charger on it and it resets but no fan spin.  could this still be the smc if the fan did not spin on the smc bypass?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a green light no power
threads.message: okay i replaced some components around the smc and got the light to go orange now and when i do an smc by pass the fan spins now. i changed out the smc and still the same thing, and 8.59v on ppbus.  possibly a bad smc i changed it out with or not well soldered maybe?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165-a green light no power
threads.message: fixed, was a bad smc from a donor board.
